Definition.WordDefinition: Birt \Birt\ (b[~e]rt), n. [OE. byrte; cf. F. bertonneau. Cf. {Bret}, {Burt}.] (Zo["o]l.) A fish of the turbot kind; the brill. [Written also {burt}, {bret}, or {brut}.] [Prov. Eng.] [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition: Burt n : English psychologist whose studies of twins were later said to have used fabricated data (1883-1971) [syn: {Cyril Burt}, {Cyril Lodowic Burt}]
